page.title: 09Work on Coton Clanford Farm
page.content: The livestock on the farm consists of a dairy herd of eighty Frisians. The one year old heifers are served by a Herefordshire bull to produce small first calves. They are later served by Friesian artificial insemination. Most of the farmland is used for grazing. The arable land consists of sixteen acres of wheat, nine acres of barley and twenty-five acres of hay and silage grass. The farm owns a small combine harvester There are three tractors, one of one hundred horse power, one of ninety-five and a light tractor for general farm- yard traction.
